Detailed Description

Splits a string blob into individual element strings.

This function should be used to extract the return values from the Cipl Manager.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

CSplitBlob::CSplitBlob ( const TCHAR *  szBlob,
TCHAR  tcEscape = 0 
) [inline]

Splits a blob into individual element strings.

This function creates temporary buffers to hold the elements. The original szBlob string is unchanged.

Parameters:
szBlobis the string blob to split.
tcEscapeis the escape character.
CSplitBlob::~CSplitBlob ( ) [inline]

Gets the element item in the string blob.

Parameters:

nColis the column index.
Returns:
The string associated with element if it exists.
NULL otherwise.

Returns the number of rows.

Returns:
An integer representing the number of rows.
TCHAR* CSplitBlob::GetRow ( int  nRow) [inline]

Gets the string associated with nRow.

The string will still have embedded escape characters.

Parameters:
nRowis the row index.
Returns:
The string associated with nRow if it exists.
NULL otherwise.
bool CSplitBlob::IsArray ( ) [inline]

Returns true if the StringBlob is a 2D array.

This is if there is at least a newline separator.

Returns:
true if the StringBlob is a 2D array.
false otherwise.

Prints the string blob.
